title: Quarkus native building using third party library
body:
### Describe the bug

Hi everyone, 

I'm finding some issues trying to build a native executable using Quarkus native-image plugin on GRAALVM 23.0 JDK 17.
Shortly i'm implementing a jwt authentication in my Quarkus application using another alredy working library (also written by me) doing all the logic through io.jsonwebtoken dependecies (jjwt-impl, jjwt-api, jjwt-jackson). The native building process succeed without any errors or warning but when i run the executable it throws the exception: 

`2024-02-05 14:52:33,296 INFO  [it.pnt.net.qua.han.ExceptionHandler] (executor-thread-1) Unable to load class named [io.jsonwebtoken.impl.DefaultJwtBuilder] from the thread context, current, or system/application ClassLoaders.  All heuristics have been exhausted.  Class could not be found.  Have you remembered to include the jjwt-impl.jar in your runtime classpath`

### Expected behavior

Everything works fine as expected

### Actual behavior

Throwing of an exception 

### How to Reproduce?

_No response_

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_
